intro: Bobua suishariensis, commonly known as the Sushari bobua, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes shrubs and evergreen plants adapted to nutrient-poor soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
